author: makepeace12
body:
Posted this last week but it feels like it needs to be said again. 


no one is gonna care about this post, but I felt compelled by the spirit to write it up.

For all the noobs about there. Here are my big lessons on the market.

1.	⁠Earnings are wayyyy too risky to hold through. Do not hold through earnings. Buy 1-2 weeks out when IV is still low, watch that shit swing up right before the bell on ER day. Sell *minutes* before 4pm.
2.	⁠If a company drops after ER, and if they only missed ER by a little bit, then buy that fucking dip and watch it rip in the coming days/weeks.
3.	⁠Do not buy PTON or ROKU. They will fuck your life up.
4.	⁠Play the big names, AMZN, GOOGL, MSFT, V.
5.	⁠Red days usually mean green days are around the corner. Load up on red days, sell on green days.
6.	⁠Do not buy PTON or ROKU.
7.	⁠Do not play biomedical. See EPZM, AIMT.
8.	⁠Listen to the old heads here, they have a lot of game.
9.	⁠Trust your gut.
10.	⁠SELL INTO STRENGTH.

author: makepeace12
body:
no one is gonna care about this post, but I felt compelled by the spirit to write it up. 

For all the noobs about there. Here are my big lessons on the market. 

1) Earnings are wayyyy too risky to hold through. Do not hold through earnings. Buy 1-2 weeks out when IV is still low, watch that shit swing up right before the bell on ER day. Sell \*minutes\* before 4pm. 

2) If a company drops after ER, and if they only missed ER by a little bit, then buy that fucking dip and watch it rip in the coming days/weeks. 

3) Do not buy PTON or ROKU. They will fuck your life up. 

4) Play the big names, AMZN, GOOGL, MSFT, V. 

5) Red days usually mean green days are around the corner. Load up on red days, sell on green days. 

6) Do not buy PTON or ROKU. 

7) Do not play biomedical. See EPZM, AIMT. 

8) Listen to the old heads here, they have a lot of game. 

9) Trust your gut. 

10) SELL INTO STRENGTH.

author: makepeace12
body:
Just gonna throw this out there:

MA just announced they got approval to get into China. We all know Visa is next. If I were you, I would try to capture this news. Visa looks like a bloody whore right now, but that means calls are cheap, and when the China approval news hits for Visa you bet your ass it's gonna spike.

Buy V now, sell on the China approval news.

Edit: Also rarely do people make money by beating a dead fucking horse. ya I am in on MSFT, but if you were actually smart, start looking for the next stock to rip. And my humble suggestion is that it might be V.

author: hello-world-foo-bar
body:
I beat cilivilation V on emperor setting so I know a thing or two about planning.

China may be open monday, but most factories will be closed or low staff because there are not enough mask and road closures.

Therefore supply chain risk is still high and growing.

You'll see this in moves in commodities, oil in particular, since oil demand is correlated with industrial utilization.

3 weeks and we have a supply chain meltdown.

author: AlohaTrader
body:
>I was wondering if it works in Europe

Yes, it will work in Europe.

>I’m considering asking a friend in the UK if he’d like to use my share code

Your friend needs to be 18 years or older, have a U.S. SSN, have a legal residence within the 50 states, and be a U.S. Citizen, permanent resident or hold a valid U.S. visa.

There's a difference between Robinhood working outside of the US versus making an account outside of the US.

author: yoloramen
body: For those that are new to trading there is a good chance we get a 20%+ selloff before this over.  This is more likely to play out like end of 2018 and that is the good scenario.  No way will this be a V bottom from here.  We just had the strongest companies warn, still have to get through all midsize and weak ones next.  Reminds me of 2008 possible scenerio but a totally different catalyst.  If you see junk bond market falling and any hint of credit market seizing up we ded.

author: MedialEpicondylitis
body:
Director of the MRC center for Global Infectious Disease Analysis in London talking about [beer virus](https://youtube.com/watch?v=ALQTdCYGISw)

His main points :

- China: 10% of cases detected
- Overseas: 25% of cases detected
- 50,000 new infections /day in China
- Doubling every 5 days
- Limited evidence of slowing
- Wuhan peak: 1 month
- China peak: 2 to 3 months
- Mild carriers self-sustaining
- Onset to death >20 days

I think next week we will get a nasty surprise. But  what do I know? Just a regular autist like everyone else.

author: JeffB1517
body:
The bear will start before there is an actual recession.  And remember there are bears not tied to recessions and visa versa.  

 During the start of a bear most people will think they are still in a bull.  Most stocks are fine and there was just overvaluation....   As the economy turns down (since this is a recession scenario) earnings will tumble on many stocks.  Even as stocks fall multiples will get worse and there is more risk.  The news coming from companies will be bad.  r/Investing will be carrying a string of bad news stories from the stocks having problems including the daily bankruptcies.  Some multiples will be extremely good but people will be focusing on the ones that are tanking.

There is never value in the absence of fear and there is never fear in the absence of justification.

author: swamprat70
body:
Pump was just shorts covering. I think next week will be choppy and unprofitable for everyone then it's probably gonna drill down some more when it decides to pick a direction.

The virus noise won't go away for a couple months and I think the VIX will stay relatively elevated. There won't be a strong V shape recovery since its impossible to tell if the virus will actually impact the economy in any meaningful way.

author: HealerWarrior
body:
Most of those you tubers aren’t advocating chasing high dividends. They advocate for dividend growth. Companies like AAPL & MSFT are included in most of those portfolios. Dividend Growth investing in companies who grow a dividend of 3-4% may not be your preferred strategy, but it does have its merits. Chasing 11% dividends is obviously a bad idea. 

BRK.B not paying a dividend is irrelevant to your first point. If you look through BRK.B’s holdings you’ll see quite a few dividend growth stocks (KO, AAPL, MA, V, UPS, PG, WFC, JNJ, JPM, AXP).

author: warm_and_sunny
body: I remember when I turned 19 like 3-4 years ago and I had like 10k saved up from working for years. I wanted to invest in the stock market and I chose a couple of stocks to stick $1000 into each. I remember it was like nvidia, AMD, Msft, apple, Facebook, visa, and a couple other tech stocks. I was deadset on doing that but then I found WSB and I chose to just keep that money cash and use like 1k to fuck around with. I lost the 1k in like 2 days then I quit WSB for a long ass time until today.  First day back, I bought $500 worth of SPY calls because I looked at the RSI and moving day average thinking it’s super oversold, and immediately after I bought spy tanked lmfao. Fuck me I’m so bad at this. Definitely gonna quit forever after tomorrow, hopefully my calls aren’t worth $0 😂

author: brutalpancake
body:
Long dive? Because it was up big premarket and then faded today along with most stuff?

Look at the goddamn 2 year chart. It rarely makes huge moves but is consistently strong. Quietly churns through new ATHs all the time, and every significant dip is bought back up within a week.

This one and V are the most reliable stocks I follow. They’ll make you money but you have to be patient: buy 1-2 strikes up and give it a couple months. You won’t pull down 500% on weeklies with these

author: psytokine_storm
body:
Have you guys every seen a video of a [dam burst](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RcNqv0dm2lA)? Skip to 1:30 to see what I'm talking about.

It's really interesting, because although the erosion to the structure can be seen long before it fails, there is nothing dramatic at all.. Right up until there is. Once that happens, there's no way to move fast enough to get away from the ensuing tsunami.

It's possible that our dam won't burst this week, or this month... but the erosion to the internal structure of the financial system is clear. This market feels more like a game of musical chairs than a means of allocating value.

Stay safe out there.

author: AffordableGold
body:
I think your hypothesis is wrong. That if this virus was gonna kill markets it already would have when Wuhan was first shut down. That's implying that the market is perfectly rational. Its quick v shaped recovery was the market digesting a short term disruption to only that region.

Now its coming to the realization that the virus could potential spread globally, causing a world wide slowdown and possible black span event. It is now digesting that.

Now I don't disagree with your other comments about what the fed said, and the strong dollar. But I see it more of a pile on to an already bad market environment.
